alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 12 at 3:44AM AKST until December 14 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM MONDAY TO MIDNIGHT AKST MONDAY NIGHT MAINLY FROM DILLINGHAM NORTH AND WEST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Bristol Bay. * WHEN...From 9 AM Monday to midnight AKST Monday night. * IMPACTS...Expect degraded traveling conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to as low as one quarter mile. Arctic air temperatures combined with the wind will cause wind chills to be as low as 35 degrees below zero which could frostbite in as little as 10 to 15 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
